metadata.Title: CVE-2013-1054 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
The unity-firefox-extension package could be tricked into destroying the Unity webapps context, causing Firefox to crash. This could be achieved by spinning the event loop inside the webapps initialization callback. Fixed in 3.0.0+14.04.20140416-0ubuntu1.14.04.1 by shipping an empty package, thus disabling the extension entirely.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-1054` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libufe-xidgetter0 - 3.0.0+14.04.20140416-0ubuntu1.14.04.1
xul-ext-unity - 3.0.0+14.04.20140416-0ubuntu1.14.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> plugin was disabled by shipping empty packages

criterions.comment: unity-firefox-extension package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.0.0+14.04.20140416-0ubuntu1.14.04.1').
